p: COVID-19 patients present with fever, headache, sore throat, cough, shortness of breath, and less commonly, myalgias, diarrhea, and nausea or vomiting [ 92]. Furthermore, the principal laboratory derangements seen in COVID-19 patients includes anemia, lymphopenia, elevated ferritin, elevated liver enzymes AST (aspartate transaminase) and ALT (alanine aminotransferase), elevated CRP (c-reactive protein), elevated D-dimer, and thrombocytopenia [ 100, 101, 102]. Initial imaging findings typically reveal bilateral infiltrates, unilateral infiltrates, or pleural effusion [ 100, 101, 102].
